title: How to Say “Yes” in Different Languages

steps.title: In English say "Yes."
steps.content: In English say "Yes." (Sounds like "yehss.") [1] X Research source

steps.title: In Spanish and Italian, say "Sí."
steps.content: In Spanish and Italian, say "Sí." (Sounds like "see.") [2] X Research source

steps.title: If French say "Oui" (Sounds like "we."
steps.content: If French say "Oui" (Sounds like "we." ) [3] X Research source

steps.title: In German, Dutch, Afrikaans, Swedish and Norwegian it is "Ja."
steps.content: In German, Dutch, Afrikaans, Swedish and Norwegian it is "Ja." (Sounds like "Yah.")

steps.title: In Danish and Faroese it is "Ja."
steps.content: In Danish and Faroese it is "Ja." (Sounds like "yeah".)

steps.title: In Portuguese and Cape-Verdean Creole it is "Sim" (Sounds like "sing")
steps.content: In Portuguese and Cape-Verdean Creole it is "Sim" (Sounds like "sing")

steps.title: In Hebrew(Yiddish) it is "Ken."
steps.content: In Hebrew(Yiddish) it is "Ken." [4] X Research source

steps.title: In Esperanto it is "Jes."
steps.content: In Esperanto it is "Jes." (Sounds like "yes.") [5] X Research source

steps.title: In Hindi and Urdu say "Haa'n" or "Gee"
steps.content: In Hindi and Urdu say "Haa'n" or "Gee"

steps.title: In Mandarin when answering an "I am" question, say "是 [Shi]" (Sounds like "Shr."
steps.content: In Mandarin when answering an "I am" question, say "是 [Shi]" (Sounds like "Shr." )

steps.title: In Serbian, Croatian, Bulgarian, and Romanian say "Da"
steps.content: In Serbian, Croatian, Bulgarian, and Romanian say "Da"

steps.title: In Slovene, say "Ja" (or "Da" in highly official situations)
steps.content: In Slovene, say "Ja" (or "Da" in highly official situations)

steps.title: In Welsh, say "Ydw" or "Oes" (Sounds like "Uh-do" or "Oy-s")
steps.content: In Welsh, say "Ydw" or "Oes" (Sounds like "Uh-do" or "Oy-s")

steps.title: In Indonesian and Malaysian, say "Ya" (sounds like "Yah")
steps.content: In Indonesian and Malaysian, say "Ya" (sounds like "Yah")

steps.title: In Tamil, say "Sari" (சரி) (pronounced sa-ri) or "Aam" (ஆம்) (sounds like Ām).
steps.content: In Tamil, say "Sari" (சரி) (pronounced sa-ri ) or "Aam" (ஆம்) (sounds like Ām ).
